result.execSummary:
The defendant Branden Ray Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber release for employment
Consecutive to: Count 2 and any other sentence being served, with credit for 6 days time served

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, costs, fees, and assessments by the end of supervision period or any remaining balance shall convert to civil judgment---bail to apply. Pay all supervision fees.
Obtain/maintain full time employment or full time school with part time employment.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Participate in Cognitive thinking program.
Cooperate with any and all rules set forth by the probation agent.

records.addlTxt: Justice Point report, received and filed.

Defendant Branden Ray Walker in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Jury Trial.  Defense advised that Branch 21 and ADA Ballenger in jury trial on an unrelated matter.  New date selected with the parties.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report, received and filed.

Defendant Branden Ray Walker in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Defense motion to adjourn the sentencing hearing to allow the defendant time to complete community service is granted by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

AS TO AMENDED COUNTS 1 & 2:  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 21.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-08-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Branden Ray Walker in court with attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Jesica A Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 10 FOR BRANCH 21
Amended Information received and filed.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to 2 MISDEMEANOR COUNTS:  COUNT 1:  FLEEING, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 346.04(2t), 346.17(2t), an Unclassified Misdemeanor; and COUNT 2:  DISORDERLY CONDUCT, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 939.51 (3)(b), a Class B Misdemeanor.
JusticePoint report, received and filed.

Defendant Branden Ray Walker in court with Attorney Jeffrey A Schwarz.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in plea negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint report, received and filed.

Defendant Branden Ray Walker in court with Attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Jesica Ann Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in plea negotiations.  Status conference scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint report, received and filed.

Defendant Branden Ray Walker in court with attorney Jeffrey A. Schwarz.  Karl Hayes for Jesica Ann Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 3/7/14.
